p: The sponge Tedaniophorbas ceratosis (20 g, wet weight) was chopped into small pieces and exhaustively extracted with MeOH (6 Ã— 200 mL) in an ultrasonic bath (20 min. per extraction) to afford a yellow brown residue (0.892 g). This extract was then separated by reversed phase C 18 HPLC gradient elution from H 2O to MeOH (containing 1% TFA) over 60 min. and then eluted with MeOH (containing 1% TFA) for 10 min. to afford 70 fractions. Fractions 17 and 18 contained tedaniophorbasin A 1 and N-methyltryptamine, which were subsequently separated by recrystallization from MeOH. Tedaniophorbasin A ( 1) was crystallized from the solution to leave N-methyltryptamine in the supernatant. Fraction 20 eluting with 66% H 2O/34% MeOH yielded pure N-methyltryptamine, and fraction 27 eluting with 55% H 2O/45% MeOH (all containing 1% TFA) yielded pure tedaniophorbasin B ( 2).
